message.content:
cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.MA, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of multi-agent task allocation, which is a common topic in the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The focus of the paper is on designing an AI Task Allocator (AITA) that can explain its allocation decisions to human teammates, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the challenges of dealing with selfish agents and incomplete knowledge, which are common issues in multi-agent systems (cs.MA) and social intelligence (cs.SI). Finally, the paper proposes a method for generating explanation trees, which involves machine learning techniques such as decision trees and reinforcement learning, falling under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
